description: see http://hl7.org/fhir/json.html#schema for information about the FHIR Json Schemas

allOf.description: A guidance response is the formal response to a guidance request, including any output parameters returned by the evaluation, as well as the description of any proposed actions to be taken.

requestId.description: The id of the request associated with this response. If an id was given as part of the request, it will be reproduced here to enable the requester to more easily identify the response in a multi-request scenario.

module.description: A reference to the knowledge module that was invoked.

status.description: The status of the response. If the evaluation is completed successfully, the status will indicate success. However, in order to complete the evaluation, the engine may require more information. In this case, the status will be data-required, and the response will contain a description of the additional required information. If the evaluation completed successfully, but the engine determines that a potentially more accurate response could be provided if more data was available, the status will be data-requested, and the response will contain a description of the additional requested information.

evaluationMessage.description: Messages resulting from the evaluation of the artifact or artifacts. As part of evaluating the request, the engine may produce informational or warning messages. These messages will be provided by this element.

outputParameters.description: The output parameters of the evaluation, if any. Many modules will result in the return of specific resources such as procedure or communication requests that are returned as part of the operation result. However, modules may define specific outputs that would be returned as the result of the evaluation, and these would be returned in this element.

action.description: The actions, if any, produced by the evaluation of the artifact.

dataRequirement.description: If the evaluation could not be completed due to lack of information, or additional information would potentially result in a more accurate response, this element will a description of the data required in order to proceed with the evaluation. A subsequent request to the service should include this data.

allOf.description: A guidance response is the formal response to a guidance request, including any output parameters returned by the evaluation, as well as the description of any proposed actions to be taken.

actionIdentifier.description: A unique identifier for the action. The identifier SHALL be unique within the container in which it appears, and MAY be universally unique.

label.description: A user-visible label for the action.

title.description: The title of the action displayed to a user.

description.description: A short description of the action used to provide a summary to display to the user.

textEquivalent.description: A text equivalent of the action to be performed. This provides a human-interpretable description of the action when the definition is consumed by a system that may not be capable of interpreting it dynamically.

concept.description: The concept represented by this action or its sub-actions.

supportingEvidence.description: The evidence grade and the sources of evidence for this action.

relatedAction.description: A relationship to another action such as "before" or "30-60 minutes after start of".

documentation.description: Didactic or other informational resources associated with the action that can be provided to the CDS recipient. Information resources can include inline text commentary and links to web resources.

type.description: The type of action to perform (create, update, remove).

behavior.description: A behavior associated with the action. Behaviors define how the action is to be presented and/or executed within the receiving environment.

resource.description: The resource that is the target of the action (e.g. CommunicationRequest).

allOf.description: A guidance response is the formal response to a guidance request, including any output parameters returned by the evaluation, as well as the description of any proposed actions to be taken.

actionIdentifier.description: The unique identifier of the related action.

relationship.description: The relationship of this action to the related action.

offsetDuration.description: A duration or range of durations to apply to the relationship. For example, 30-60 minutes before.

offsetRange.description: A duration or range of durations to apply to the relationship. For example, 30-60 minutes before.

anchor.description: An optional indicator for how the relationship is anchored to the related action. For example "before the start" or "before the end" of the related action.

allOf.description: A guidance response is the formal response to a guidance request, including any output parameters returned by the evaluation, as well as the description of any proposed actions to be taken.

type.description: The type of the behavior to be described, such as grouping, visual, or selection behaviors.

value.description: The specific behavior. The code used here is determined by the type of behavior being described. For example, the grouping behavior uses the grouping-behavior-type valueset.
